turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Germanisation of Poles during the Partitions.
turn.1: How did the Partitions of Poland affect the Germans?
turn.2: A joint operation of Russian and Prussian secret police managed to discover Polish organizations working in Breslau "(Wrocław)" and Berlin, whose members were arrested and detained in Prussian jails.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Intensification of anti-Polish policies started from 1830 onwards.
turn.5: Why were they trying to stop Polish independence?
turn.6: As the November Uprising in Russian-held Congress Poland began, Prussians closely worked with Russia in regards to stopping any Polish independence drive.
turn.7: Did they have any other means of doing this?
turn.8: A state of emergency was introduced in the Duchy, police surveillance started on a large scale and 80,000 soldiers were moved into the area.
turn.9: What happened after they moved the soldiers into the area?
turn.10: The Prussian Foreign Minister openly declared that Prussia would oppose independence of Poland as it would mean territories taken in the Partitions of Poland could be claimed by it.
turn.12: Russians soldiers fighting Poles received food supplies, equipment, and intelligence from Prussia.
